heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A –
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – 
Temporary Requirements) (Covid-19 Passenger Locator Form) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2020.

title: other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of
heading: 2. Regulation 2 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary
text_raw:
2. Regulation 2 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary 
Requirements) (Covid-19 Passenger Locator Form) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 
181 of 2020) is amended by the substitution of “the 9th day of July 2020” for 
“the 18th day of June 2020”. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the 
 Minister for Health, 

17 June, 2020. 

SIMON HARRIS, 

Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 19th June, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [217] 3

title: other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Requirements) (Covid-19 
Passenger Locator Form) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 181 of 2020) provide for 
the imposition of a requirement that international passengers (including Irish 
citizens) arriving in the State at a port or airport from a place outside the State 
complete a COVID-19 Passenger Locator Form for the purposes of recording 
and verifying information regarding their contact details and place of residence 
for a period of up to 14 days following arrival. These Regulations amend S.I. 
No. 181 of 2020 to provide that it shall remain in operation until the 9th day of 
July 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [217]
